t: Iggy and the Stooges - The Official Iggy and the Stooges Site
s: Iggy’s 1997 remix of Raw Power, Iggy and The Stooges’ explosive third album, is the VMP Rock Record of the Month for September 2023. It’s here on 180g “Heart Full of Napalm” vinyl with AAA lacquers cut from tapes by Ryan Smith and Joe Nino-Hernes at Sterling Sound.

t: Vinyl - Iggy Pop & the Stooges - Russia Melodia
POP,IGGY & THE STOOGES - Rough Power [Vinyl] - Amazon.com Music
s: To me, this is a really great slice ... from the Stooges as more free-form Detroit home-town boys (although obviously they had graduated to Hollywood and New York by this time as well) to the more conventional and managed "excess" of the Pop-Williamson team promoted by Mainman and beyond. The included earlier song, "No Fun," really helps in making this distinction. ... The truth is you need all three versions of Raw Power. Each mix sounds like an entirely different album. Get Iggy's re-mix first ...

s: From reading the threads on this on the stooges forum, it would seem they were done by two german guys who own a small studio in the US and have a habit of doing this kind of thing. i bought it and hated it, buy the heavy liquid boxset instead, as at least the royalties from that will go to Iggy, ...

s: An outstanding sample of Iggy and The Stooges refining material in the studio, the 18 restored/remastered tracks spanning two discs are from 1972 and 1973. What is particularly interesting is the completeness of most numbers, though none were probably destined for a record company vault for ...

t: The Stooges (album) - Wikipedia
s: 3 weeks ago - For their first album, the Stooges had intended to record seven songs: "I'm Sick", “Asthma Attack”, "Dance Of The Romance" / “Goodbye Bozos”, No Fun", "I Wanna Be Your Dog", and "1969". “I’m Sick” was a bolero that Iggy Pop had written on a Wurlitzer electronic piano and when ...
